title: AB 1685
content: The people of California enact the following. Section 43016 of the Health and Safety Code is amended to impose civil penalties for violations of emission control laws, with specific fines outlined for different types of violations. Manufacturers or distributors may be required to pay penalties and ensure compliance with regulations to continue selling regulated products in California. The state board adjusts maximum penalties for inflation based on the California Consumer Price Index, exempt from the Administrative Procedure Act. Penalties collected are deposited in the Air Pollution Control Fund. Section 43151 of the Health and Safety Code prohibits the sale, import, or use of uncertified motor vehicles or engines in California. The article does not apply to a vehicle acquired to replace a damaged or stolen vehicle, a vehicle transferred by inheritance or court decree, or a vehicle sold after a specific legislative amendment date if it was registered before that date. Section 43154 of the Health and Safety Code is amended to impose a civil penalty of up to $37,500 for violating emission control laws. Manufacturers or distributors may also be required to pay the penalty and ensure compliance with the laws to continue selling vehicles in the state. A dealer violating emission control laws may face a civil penalty of up to $10,000 per violation, with adjustments for inflation. The penalty recovery action can be initiated by the Attorney General on behalf of the state board in the superior court. Penalties collected will be deposited in the Air Pollution Control Fund. Section 43211 of the Health and Safety Code states that new motor vehicles in California must meet emission standards set by the state board. Manufacturers selling vehicles that fail to meet these standards may face civil penalties up to $37,500 per violation. Additionally, penalties for not meeting zero-emission vehicle credit requirements are capped at $5,000 per credit. The maximum penalty amounts will be adjusted for inflation based on the California Consumer Price Index, with penalties collected going into the General Fund. Any penalty recovered pursuant to this section shall be deposited into the General Fund. Section 43212 of the Health and Safety Code is amended to impose civil penalties on manufacturers or distributors who do not comply with emission standards, with a maximum penalty of $37,500 per vehicle. Penalties collected will be deposited into the Air Pollution Control Fund. The state board may order a manufacturer of motor vehicles to bring its vehicles into compliance with certified emissions configuration. Compliance may be required for continued sale in the state, with penalties deposited into the Air Pollution Control Fund.
